intro: Sipanea hispida, commonly known as the rough sipanea, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or pink in color. Sipanea hispida thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and taxonomic research.
